author: {'steamid': '76561198025035050', 'num_games_owned': 7580, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1687242488}
review:
I just tested this old game, a long-time favorite of mine, on the Steam Deck and it works BEAUTIFULLY. In fact, it plays far better on Deck than it does on the PC with mouse. This is because it as originally designed for play on touch screens and then was ported over.
Since it has a Linux build, it runs natively, and the game mechanic itself - drawing lines of gunpowder, works far better with the Deck touchscreen than with a cursor. Add to that the fun graphics, challenging and interesting gameplay, and wonderful music, and this is the PERFECT casual but challenging Steam Deck puzzle game. It's just a shame it doesn't have the "Great on Deck" logo to let people know!

Highly recommended for fellow Steam Deck players!

author: {'steamid': '76561198962870049', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1656631242}
review: Originally found, payed and played this game on its Windows 8.1 store edition, I absolutely loved it. Since it was removed from the ms store nowadays I went crazy when I searched it on steam after years and found it there yesterday. Today I had finished every puzzle and achievement again, absolutely recommended, not only for its extremely low price but also for the really fun levels and animations! Really from the top of its kind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993531522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1634309342}
review:
Well I got around 3 hours of enjoyment from this game while amassing 72/75 Pigs in Chapter 1. (25 levels in total.) Draw your line of gunpowder, light yer fuse and watch things go ka-boom in explosive and inventive chain reactions. Very satisfying! This alone, from a £1.59 game, gets it the thumbs-up.

Move on to Chapter 2 and you have to frantically place your gunpowder and light a fuse before a slow moving train knocks over key objects scuppering your plans... making it more of a game about skilful mouse control than careful planning. Personally, unfortunately, that was game over right there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025812458', 'num_games_owned': 1991, 'num_reviews': 445, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1588579199}
review: Gunpowder is actually a surprisingly decent puzzle game. That being said, it's a game that strikes me as being much more suitable for iOS or iPad as it's not very attention-keeping compared to the countless other games available on Steam. When you've not got much else to play, you could definitely do worse than Gunpowder. At $2, I can't really complain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025823574', 'num_games_owned': 3339, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1549568403}
review:
Not sure if it's the best, but very good amounts of *bang* for your buck.

Jokes aside the game is solid, plays well, is pretty varied - I felt a bit tired of it around the end so only played a few levels each time. But considering it has 5+1 chapters, each with 25 levels, the player definitely needs some breaks on the go.

If you like what you see in the trailer - that's the game. Some levels require a certain level of precision in execution and/or timing, but it's never overbearing. The site HowLongToBeat lists the game as a 14.5 hour long one, for the low price of 2 $/€  it's an outstanding puzzle game, with fire and explosions!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987180715', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3753, 'last_played': 1628868019}
review: The game is simple: cleverly utilize your environment to open a safe.  This is achieved through designing a trail of gunpowder to trigger, ignite, or blow up surrounding items which often leads to a chain reaction.  You get a higher score if you use less gunpowder and solve the puzzle as fast as you can.  Coming up with a top notch solution on some maps requires you to optimize and/or think outside the box.  With 150 levels, you easily get more than you paid for.  Although the game does become a little repetive at times, with each chapter the game introduces new environmental items and variants to keep the puzzles interesting.  If you are looking for a puzzle game that rewards both wits and excellent mouse speed/coordination, this is a great option.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998266429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1515013578}
review: Puzzling, challenging but never impossble. A cracking game - definitely worth playing on PC due to the bigger screen and mouse control makes a big difference.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992229015', 'num_games_owned': 1184, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1507683091}
review:
Let's be clear here: This game only costs 2 bucks. When it's not on sale. You can hardly fuck up so hard that it won't be worth those 2 bucks. For me, it was worth about 7 hours of puzzling.

The game consists of 5 "worlds" with 25 levels each. Every world introduces new and different gimmicks, from speeding trains to waterfalls to machine guns to self driving lorry carts, elevators, etc. etc. Your goal each time is to blow up the big green safe and optionally the three piggie banks (and if you can and want the hidden object). Unfortunately, this being a mobile port, you need to destroy quite a few of those piggie banks to unlock later worlds, which is funny, because within each world every level is immediately available. To do so you have to generally blow up barrels and connect them with blackpowder lines. This is all pretty fun and stuff, IF NOT for the infuriating design decision to include timed "drag" levels. What I mean by that is that there are quite a few levels in the game in which you have to blow up an obstacle, ignite a fuse and "drag" it around the screen until the obstacle is gone and you can continue to the next obstacle. If you expect just a slow and peaceful puzzler, let this one go, as things can get quite hectic, especially later on, when you also have to manipulate the machinery and more in the levels. For example: In later levels it is crucial to change the direction of train tracks many different times while there is an on fire mine cart on its way. This can get very stressful.

If you can deal with that, however, you have yourself a nifty little "action puzzler" with ok graphics, ok music, incredibly annoying sound effects and the inclusion of a "story" for whatever reason. The 10 comic book style panels are just kind of unnecessary and don't even convey any meaningful information.

After you've destroyed enough piggie banks you can also unlock the "hidden levels", which is just another chapter of 25 that were supposedly scrapped from the game at some point? Dunno. The game teases you with "more levels soon" after that, but seeing as the last update on Steam was in 2015 I highly doubt that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043774950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1499027584}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1538932029}
review:
Tags: Casual - Object Routes & Flinger
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Meant for touch tablet. Game slides into trial and error and twitch reaction stressful gameplay as difficulty increases. Limited appeal.

This is a somewhat well executed single screen puzzle object routing game with a twist. You have to make trails of gunpowder to connect kegs so that when you start fire everything blows up.

The idea is fun, but the solutions are not open to experimentation or play. There is one correct way of doing things, and that correct way of doing things is increasingly finnicky to execute as the game carries on. For example missions can require you to start the fire first, before allowing you to place extra kegs to connect everything.

The game sets silly time objectives which you have no hope in achieving if you do not know the solutions in advance. The click and drag interface also adds delay compared to simple touch which this was designed for.

Conclusion: Ultimately this is just getting something from point A to point B. It does so with a twist, and if it had a cleaned up gameplay it would be worthwhile. But ultimately the object routes genre really does not live up as a sit down PC entertainment genre, and what few games are worthwhile enough usually bleed over into other genres. For example Frozen Synapse does object routing with a tactical edge.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/445020/Frozen_Synapse_2/

author: {'steamid': '76561198012597716', 'num_games_owned': 2187, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1464565355}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118005728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 566, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1455427439}
review: Gunpowder is a western style puzzler with cartoony graphics thats a literal blast to play! You use fire or dynamite along with gunpowder to make barrels explode and blow up piggy banks and safes. Sometimes you have a limited amount of gunpowder which of course makes it more challenging. There are also cannons and other things that you have to use to blow up the piggy banks and safes. Overall its a fun and addicting puzzler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1454473223}
review:
I liked the game for the first chapter and a half, despite some issues.

Then the game became more annoying than fun. I realized it was time to uninstall the game when I couldn't get a level to complete sucessfully more than one time in ten attempts, despite doing the same thing each time. I guess my traill of gunpowder was off by one pixel.

After a few levels like this I realized that I had no idea if I was doing a level incorrectly or the level was poorly designed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968611839', 'num_games_owned': 2619, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1515200167}
review:
-Steam for removing my review-


This game is quite entertaining despite not passing my yes/no recommendation which is largely in part of poor integration of the options menu, lack of sliders for music and sound although positive note being that they are, at the least, separate checkmarkable options.

Almost all of the settings that can be changed require a restart of the game.

Hacked clients / memory scores are allowed to make the leaderboards ( ie some levels where the minimum burn-time of shortest path of powder exceeds the lowest times on the leaderboard which is only possible by cheating / altering memory ). There are a few tricks that can be used to lower the time taken such as drawing a line of gunpowder to the fire and while it burns to the next target, draw another string of powder to the next target, and so on... But, the issue with hacked clients able to alter their time using memory editors and then allowing those falsified scores on a leaderboard is annoying, to say the least. Some of the times, however, are realistic, but only with the help of a macro system, otherwise there'd be little to no way of manually performing the tasks in the time recorded by the leaderboards.

Time starts when you load into the level instead of when you place the first object or the first powder and your view is blocked for the first few seconds by a window that opens giving you information or garbage to read.

Black powder can be buggy in the sense that it will not ignite all of the time; I've laid out multiple strands from a single point and not all of them ignited despite overlapping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057849814', 'num_games_owned': 1159, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1451522129}
review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Gunpowder
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2015
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] 2D; Puzzle; Mobile-Era Puzzle; Casual; Lighthearted
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A-
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 5-10 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Puzzle game aficionados; Casual gamers
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Gunpowder[/b] is a casual, two-dimensional puzzle game with a large amount of short levels, a 3-star system, and leaderboards. It is cut from the same cloth as games like [i]Angry Birds[/i], [i]Cut the Rope[/i], and the many other mobile-era puzzle games out there. Nevertheless, [b]Gunpowder[/b] does have its own independent identity. The gameplay is a perfect mix of planning and playing that combines well with the theme of the game to create a unique and charming experience.

It is a very simplistic game, so if you are seeking something with depth or immersion: this isn’t it. But if you enjoy playing casual puzzle games of this style, then [b]Gunpowder[/b] is probably going to be a good bet for you.

As I alluded to, the mixture of planning and action/reaction that is inherent in the puzzle-solving creates some really enjoyable gameplay. It will make you think a bit, but manages to not get overly confusing. That synthesizes brilliantly with the jovial, lighthearted theme of the game to make the whole experience unequivocally pleasurable. It is the perfect game to put a smile on your face in those moments you are just looking to kick-back and relax.

There are a lot of levels (150+), but they are pretty short and easy to solve; although some of the later levels are decently challenging. For all levels, once you find the solution there isn’t much reason to try again for the average gamer, unless you are someone who relishes in the opportunity to compete on the leaderboards. I was satisfied with the amount of content, but you will have to make your own assessment on that front.

So, while I understand not everyone is a fan of this genre, I posit that anyone who is a fan should have an easy time enjoying [b]Gunpowder[/b]. There was a good job done by the developers in creating a unique identity for the game, and it is one of the more entertaining examples of the genre.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1437312750}
review:
[h1]Gunpowder est un jeu de reflexion dans une ambiance western[/h1]

L’histoire se déroule le siècle dernier aux Etats-Unis, à l’époque des cow-boys et des indiens.

Vous jouez Incendio, un jeune bibliothécaire qui est révolté par les injustices qui règnent autour de lui. Il décide donc de devenir l’équivalent d’un Robin des Bois. Il va voler les méchants en faisant exploser leurs coffres et redistribuer l’argent aux pauvres.

A travers les 150 niveaux du jeu, vous devez installer des explosifs à côté des coffres mais aussi des tirelires (pour débloquer les niveaux suivants). Déposez les explosifs, la poudre et soyez le plus efficace possible.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=493728382

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/07/20/test-gunpowder-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire l'ensemble de mes impressions sur Gunpowder.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000000385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1437251477}
review:
While I've only played for about half an hour at this point, I'm having a blast with Gunpowder. Even gave the hubby a laugh when he asked: "What are the pigs?" "Well, those are the bag guy's piggy banks." "Why are you blowing them up?" "So he can't finance his world take-over plans, of course!" 

I'm enjoying the puzzles. They start simple to learn the mechanics, then increase in difficulty at a good rate. They aren't so difficult that I pull my hair out, but neither to I always get best time + 3 piggies on the first try. 

My only gripe with Gunpowder: the sound! I like to keep background/environment sound on while playing games but at a minimal level, with sound effects just above that. Gunpowder is an all-or-nothing setup for sound, and I was nearly blown out of my chair when it started up! The default volume was WAY too high! Even the sound effects were blasting. So that I had some game sound, I had to turn my system volume and speakers nearly down to nothing so I could play without wincing. My hope is that there will be an update later on to incorporate volume sliders. 

Overall I'm enjoying Gunpowder, and would recommend it to anyone who likes puzzle games to pass the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111968405', 'num_games_owned': 2283, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1437257497}
review:
Lets be honest, Im not huge fan of puzzle games, especially if there is time to beat.

But this I loved from first level, animations are great, and what will make you repeat levels at least  once is crazly worldwide leaderbord.
You can try and try, and always ask yourself, how the fu?k did that or those guys finish it faster :D

Lots of levels, and if you go try chasing highscores you will have yourself many hours behind this game.

Love cartoons, puzzle and challenges ? Look no further, this is a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985036092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1438330867}
review:
Casual puzzle game with aesthetics straight out of your favorite western cartoons. Evil Boss Grimshaw has taken more then his fair share of the towns folks money.  Playing the role Incendio you have one simple goal, draw a line of gunpowder through all the explosive barrels and while making you way toward the stolen loot. Perhaps claiming some fame and glory along the way.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fzmQVbYnlRc
Levels start off simple but quickly increased in difficulty requiring you to take down entire walls, chain reactions that split into multiple paths, launch cannons on to moving river rafts and just time more explosions in general. Best scores come from taking out all the extra piggy banks which were often in more obscure locations that require careful planning. Puzzle fans who are perfectionists should find a rather addictive game and with the inclusion of a global high score board it certainly keeps you hitting the replay level button to refine skills. If not bothered can progress the story just by clearing the end safe.

While it's past history as a mobile game is rather obvious, it's far from being a terrible port. Gamepad support isn't provided given the drawing nature of the game but I had no issues with mouse control or menu navigation. Overall enjoyed Gunpowder enough to complete it as I have the spare time. Cheers folks. :)

[b]Like:[/b]
Addictive simple gameplay
Domino-esque explosions

[b]Dislike:[/b]
Okay music but a little repetitive
Price could be lower but did provide adequate challenge.

[b][u]NOTES:[/u][/b]
Gametime isn't logged correctly since I play offline.
Publisher provided a steam code. Never changes my thoughts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016960257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1436510421}
review:
Good, fun, little game. Clean presentation and smart levels make it an easy recommendation. The game doesn't strike me as being particularly long but I haven't beaten it yet nor do I feel like I'm all that close. The music could use some additional variance but what is there is pleasant and didn't irritate me. It's an all around solid package for the asking price (sub-$10). 

I streamed this game for a couple of hours and had a couple of folks watching. I think the best indication of this game's quality is the fact that I said "alright, this is the last level" multiple times just because I couldn't stop going for one more level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968006410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1478393525}
review:
I bought this on a whim not expecting it to do anything more than help fill some spare time, and the game turned out to be an excellent way to fill that time. The first few levels teach you how to play, without obviously being a tutorial or babying you along. It is extremely gratifying to complete the puzzles; blowing up piggy banks and a safe is a lot of fun.  Each level has a time limit which is often challenging, and this adds to replayability. It's easy to get hooked and play level after level.

The music is upbeat and tuneful, this is one of the few games where I haven't bothered to mute the soundtrack.

Finally, the game is polished and free of bugs and I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040225627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1436098381}
review:
A solid return for a developer studio that consists of long-time industry veterans! Yes, their next game will be much larger, but this is more than just a teaser. If you are fan a puzzelers, you will have a blast with Gunpowder and your greatest gripe would be that there isn't enough of it!

https://youtu.be/311R9rucnXU

author: {'steamid': '76561198025058377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1448914885}
review:
Quite a fun game. Although it is called a puzzle game, prepare to solve the puzzles in short time, since some puzzles require  you to change your layout after you've lit the fuse. Your score also depends on how fast you solve a puzzle. If you want to get into the top players list, figure out your solution and then show your mouse skills.

Concerning mouse skills: This game would definitely great on a touch screen, since painting with a mouse is usually not ideal.

So far, I've seen puzzle games that are much more difficult, but I've only played about 40% of the game and the level is rising.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080767860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1436377683}
review: Lege das Schwarzpulver so, dass das Feuer von der Feuerstelle aus alle Fässer explodieren lässt. Erledige die über 150 Level so schnell wie möglich und messe Dich mit anderen Spielern.  Dabei gilt es nicht nur Fässer explodieren zu lassen, sondern auch hilfreiche Gegenstände, wie zum Beispiel Kanonen zum Einsatz zu bringen. Doch alles dreht sich darum, 3 Sparschweine und die Schatztruhe zu erreichen und dies in möglichst schneller Zeit. Optisch lässt das Spiel keinerlei Wünsche offen und ist auch mit Mousesteuerung mittelmäßig gut spielbar. Trotzdem wundere ich  mich etwas über das Spielsystem. Sobald der Level beginnt, startet auch die Zeit und es gilt sofort die möglichst besten Verbindungen zu suchen. Da hätte ich mir eher gewünscht, dass die Zeit erst dann anfängt zu zählen, wenn die Feuerstelle aktiviert wurde und man somit mehr Zeit hat, darüber nachzudenken, wie der Level optimal zu lösen ist. So ist man jetzt dazu gezwungen, erst einmal einfach loszulegen und dann den Lebel so lange zu wiederholen, bis ein gutes Ergebnis erreicht wurde. Da auch noch Fässer per Mouse bei manchen Level in das Spiel eingefügt werden müssen und diese per angehaltener linker Mousetaste in das Spielfeld gezogen werden, kann also die schnellste Zeit nur schon davon abhängig sein, wie schnell ich mit der Mouse arbeite. Dies gefällt mir nicht so gut. Dies liegt wahrscheinlich daran, dass das Spiel für Touchpad programmiert wurde und die Mouse dafür einfach nicht ideal geeignet ist. Da wäre die Idee, die Zeit nach der Laufzeit der Lunte zu messen besser geeignet gewesen. Da aber alle Spieler mit dem gleichen Problem zu kämpfen haben, bleibt es natürlich gerecht.Aus diesem Grund  Daumen nach oben, da mir die Spielidee ansich gefällt und die Grafik passend ist.
